page.title: 20PLACE NAMES
page.content: Saxon Rise- the name was given to this area because when the foundations of the houses were being dug the workmen came across a number of Saxon graves. The remains and artefacts are now in Devizes museum. Mill Lane- this lane down to the possible site of the mill which served the village in Saxon times. Penny Hill- the hill leading to the church. On the green here the custom of Bun and Penny was maintained until it went to Court Farm. Sunton- this is a corruption of Southtown. Originally Sunton was the southern part of Collingbourn Kingston and children living there had to go to school in Kingston.
